performances.description: Very mellow yet authoritative. Slinky. Jerry's solo melts like no other. One of my favorite solo's he's ever done.
Superb execution by all. This show really rocks! (of course...it's May '77

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: The vocals and playing on this make it special...

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: The Official live version. Garcia-approved! Silky smooth, perfect tempo, and beautiful harmonies and dynamics.
Must hear b/c it's Jerry's first show back after the coma...crowd goes INSANE on "won't you tell everybody you meet that the Candyman's in town!"

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Smoother than the smooth side of a smooth rock. SMOOVE.
A really great version.
One of the all time versions.

performances.venue: Alligator Alley Gym, University of Florida Gainsville, FL
performances.description: Simply stunning version. This aud is unreal how good it sounds.  Gotta give a listen!
A short sweet Candyman into the headiest Cumberland Blues of all time

performances.venue: Field House - Seneca College Toronto, ON
performances.description: Just about perfect.
Nashville, where else. Vocally outlandish, solo dead on.
Jerry and Brent both stand out in this fantastic version from a stand-out show

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: Keith plays beautifully on this.
Mellow accoustic goodness - sweet and evocative. The whole set is 1970 amazingnessiosity at its headiest.
Slinky smooth, and soulful, Jerry's tone is on the money, and his vocals are top notch
Download Series Vol. 7

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Smooth as silk

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA
performances.description: Vintage 79' Dead. Jerry nails each and every note.

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY

performances.description: HOW has this AMAZING Candyman slipped through the cracks on Heady V for this long? People! It's Great!
Don't know the '70s versions enough to say "unique", but check this one out for beeeautiful vocals over light-as-light sweet acoustic playing.
soooo smooth

performances.venue: Activity Center - University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: Sweet Candyman here.  Vocals nailed and solo nailed!
Just pure ear candy Jerry's guitar is so beautiful here and his voice is smooth and crystal clear, just a gorgeous version, BEAUTIFUL, gives me CHILLS
The last great version, in the heart of Memphis.  Crowd goes nuts for the Memphis line.  Love it!
Jerome is in peak form - so freaking good.
Lucky enough to be at this show. Candyman blew everyone away--best song played that night. Awesome trippy guitar jam &Jer belts out vocals

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: Great acoustic version. Stellar vocals, especially in the "oooh" section
jerry goes for a swim. Far out

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Got a story to tell ya ain't in no hurry - so listen up!
Powerful take this night....
Classic version.
Beautiful harmonies and country soul.  Brilliant and historically important show.
Powerful, soulful vocals, ripping, dripping solo.  The FM Board version ftw.
I don't know what it is about this version...it has vocal miscues, but is just epic at an epic run.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: Delicious Candyman, just fantastic.All on top of it Phil Bombing some nice weir "rhythm", Jerry nails it, Brent backup vocals A+.
soulful and great delivery
The reason we all love 1970 and the two set acoustic/electric format. Don't miss the NRPS set from this night either!
Huge gem from the first set!
Just listen
Love it!! And you can tell they're lovin' it too!
A subtle beauty. Just a bit of swagger, just a bit of grit, lots of fine singing, and an acqueous solo for the ages.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: This is a damn good version.  Nice solo and I love Jer's ragged voice on this tune.
Guys seriously, this is top notch
acoustic
Wonderful LOVE candyman, a sweet 77 version.
Jer delivers the sweet spacefinger on this one.
Hot Jerry has one of those amazing piercing solos where the notes cut like a knife.  This is beautiful and well sung some minor mic issues but Jerry +

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Curtis Hixon
Sweet like candy
The fact that you can watch this on youtube is reason enough to vote for it! KQED "Celebration" special.
Hella sweet!!!
Awesome version of Candyman, Tight vocals and hot playing by Jerry and the whole band
Part of a tremendous opening trio on this evening.
What a treat.  Why is this show undervalued? C'mon folks, don't let a good AUD scare you.  This is a beaut, with the crowd part of the party.
Gorgeous soloing from Jerry and a tender vocal performance. The new mix on the Giants box really lets this one shine.
No Votes??? Listen to the passion in Jerry’s voice especially at 5 min on. It’s silly this isn’t voted up.

performances.venue: Soldiers' and Sailors' Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: There's a Betty Board of this one available. And it's gorgeous. What's stopping you?
Some early lyrical flubs, but otherwise a gorgeous version!
Absolutely beautiful, Jerry's guitar tone and playing nearly unmatched in this version. It just soars so beautifully, Jerry is On top of this version
Vocals start out a little creaky but loosen up as the song builds as a cool dimension to the outstanding playing on this one. Beginning of a greattour
JG sings this one so perfectly and then whips out the silver spacefinger lead.
Beautiful version.  Several very good versions of this song across April 1978, this one being my favorite.
1978: Prime weather for Candyman. This performance, like many from then, highlights the bleak world of the narrator. Garcia's break: spidery.
From Garcia's cheeky intro on, this graceful cabochon throws a faint, warm light. 1976 elegance w/a sick, raw spider web guitar break.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Brent's piano is a major factor in this hot version. Tempo is just exactly perfect.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Really nice, second song of 1st set!

performances.venue: Field House, U. of Cincinnati Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: Premiere version from the middle/acoustic set. Audible buzz on the SBD, but worth the historic interest and for Jerry's wordless penultimate verse.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
Silva Hall at the Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: Wonderful rendering heartfelt from Jerry.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theater East Troy, WI
performances.description: A raucous good time , Crowd is lively and energetic throughout.

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Liquid guitar. Lovin' it.
Trippy underwater solo like the 2/24/73 version. Only a couple months away and the resurrection of this tune starting up.
Dreamy, motionless rendition on a sea of individual human reactions [audience tape]. A wonderful time for this gem.
Wonderful...The boys take their time and pack a punch with this one
Sweet version
strong confident reading
You've never heard anything like this before.  Out take from American Beauty era, mis-dated on Archive, but absolutely wonderful.

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Particularly good version
Keith and Donna on this are just wonderful.  Strong version all around, but Keith's fillis are just outta sight.
a little sloppy but loads of fun
Cler and gorgeous you can clearly hear the crowd getting off on it. Lots of Brent and Phil. Jerry nails the guitar break. Excellent
Jerry rips a out a wicked effects laden lead.

performances.venue: Santa Fe Downs Santa Fe, NM
performances.description: Jer's voice is clear, his tone is set to CHILLY, SPACEFINGER and it' all good.

performances.venue: Kansas City Municipal Auditorium Arena Kansas City, MO
performances.description: Absolutely a top shelf version. jerry just nails it with such passion and the guitar lines are soaring played in set 2 Rarity

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: The music is so perfect on this version, minor lyric flub but still gorgeous Brent is fantastic, and Jerrry sings with clarity and passion
Intimate expression of this song's first, acoustic, right off the LP era. A bit slower, but great vocals and 3-part harmonies.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Fantastic, has a great swing, love Jerry's solo almost sounds like its bubbling out from underwater at times, Phil lays some nice bombs to play onto
Awesome Candyman at Red Rocks.
Stellar Candyman, sweet vocals and hot solo.

performances.venue: Rutgers Athletic Center New Brunswick, NJ
performances.description: Nice Candyman at Rutgers under rated show. 1981 has a lot of hot ones.
kick ass version

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Novocaine filled singing and jam.
The very last time the Candyman came around. Also the last time I saw Jer, and I was right up front for this one.

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: Locked in tight spacefinger solo. Slight bruise beforehand, no real hitch.

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Amazingly powerful solo and some fierce Jerry vocals that elicit a roaring cheer.  Check out the AUD!
Excellent well sung with a very deliberate pace to it.
very beginning is clipped but this is a great version. Clean sound despite cut.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Auditorium Oakland, CA
performances.description: The Candyman's in town alright!
Nice second set '77 one here
Slick, efficient Garcia solo, plus some cool flourishes by the Godchauxs.
Shocked I tell you, shocked this isn’t here yet. Slow with a perfect solo and laid back lyrics. Jerry has some nice fills as well.

performances.venue: Golden Hall - San Diego Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: Intimacy levels: Campfire. Acoustic mellow to the point where I feel like just went camping with my favorite band. A treasure.
very hot unhearleded show fantastic performance by all
Nearly perfected carried on by a strong performance from Jerry and some tsty accompniament from Mr. Hornsby. Really Cool.
Another absolutely faulous psychedelic cowboy 1970 dead tune

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: A spectacular take on Candyman. Jerry is just brilliant here.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: The Jerry highlight of the evening. Cool echo by Healy on jerry vocals. Stabbing piercing guitar solo. Powerful and he brings the emotion real heady

performances.venue: Silva Hall, Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: NIce Candyman from Eugene Oregon.
One of the midnight shows that confuse historians, but one of the sweet-harmony Candymans that just slay me. No confusion there.
Anthemic beauty. Great ensemble singing and powerful pacing to it. Then Janis steps on stage for Love Light, so there's that.
excellent uptempo take, has a cool swing to it. Passionate attentive take.

performances.venue: Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saratoga Springs, NY
performances.description: The band builds it up beautifully to the  "Won't you tell everyone you meet" verse.

performances.venue: Los Angeles Coliseum Los Angeles, CA

performances.description: Jerry’s feelin’ it
Jerry sounds tired and pained here, which of course is perfect. For some reason he usually doesn't nail the solo in this tune but he does here.
Vibrant version with great guitar work from John Jerome.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Sweet little first set number from '79. Always love when they play this song.

performances.venue: Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saratoga Springs, NY
performances.description: Jerry's guitar tone and fluttering ramp up solo is spine tingles.  Highly recommend!
Fantastic mid-80s version

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Center Tampa, FL
performances.description: April '78 goodness right here.  This band's ability to shift dynamics from quiet to rock 'n roll loudness never ceases to amaze me

performances.venue: Greek Theater - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: sweet
Mysterious beauty under the B- sound quality (Phil sounds kinda like a tuba, which is cool).  Beautiful vocal harmonies and break in the middle.
Great plugged in version with beautiful vocals

performances.venue: Madison Sq Garden New York, NY
performances.description: like the rest of this show, HIGH end energy. Great solo, and Garcia totally impassioned vocals. crowd goes berserk!! must listen!!

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: very nice year for Candyman, another heady version
sweet early version
2nd one ever, and doesn't flow perfectly yet. They're working out the lovely 3-part harmonies and it's just fantastic transitional Dead.
Crisp and gorgeous seek out the snbd this is terrific juicy and they are all doing such creative yet crisp playing.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theater East Troy, WI
performances.description: Brilliant, among the finest Candyman's I have ever heard. Brent is such a powerful presence throughout. Jerry's voice is gravely but strong throughout
Almost a prayer.  Stripped down, pure, harmonized and beautiful.  Fans of the acoustic Candyman shouldn't pass this one by.
Sweet second set placement, interesting set list
Wonderful late era Candyman. Very good set 1 on this night.
This is a very dramatic reading excellent effort from Jerry, crowd reacts in stupendous applause particularly to the Candyman's in town..
Jerry is so on here a great version.
Excellent mellow reading of Candyman with Jerry and Brent both in excellent form.
A real nice late era candyman, beautifully played and sung

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Excellent 1991 version!!!!
The total package, with everything this song was meant to have: Sadness, menace, self-consciousness, braggadocio, regret. A beautiful performance.
Delicious.
Warm, gooey, and dynamic.
Clear To Hell - Hear how a luscious Candyman absorbs a crowd in NC.
Jerry is on point in the first set. Excellent version with mournful vocals, crisp effected guitars, and strong Vince. Recommended!
Swells and sparkles in a way only Candymans from this era do
Emotive
Candyman fans, listen to this one

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Beautiful solo by Jerry.
A lively, relaxed version from the epic final night in Boston '91.
Spare, almost vulnerable take on this classic. Godchaux brings the church and Garcia brings the stained glass. An American beauty.
Nice laid back candyman. Love jerrys solo in this one
Sweet, gorgeous, mean and gnarly.
Undulating with the band over waves of groove
Once again Jerry adding a little extra "mph" on the vocals, this is a really great Candyman
Gorgeous solo!
Nearly perfect
smooth like silk
I think I managed to stumble upon a hidden jem. Jerry’s is so sweet sounding and shout out Donna man
Nuke test of a 4.1 candyman, hit that Pasternak AUD source. 100000 tons of brent
Candy, man

performances.venue: Laguna Seca Recreation Area Monterey, CA
performances.description: Brent is a huge factor on this stellar version, particularly near the end. Love this one, and shocked it's not listed already!

performances.venue: Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Passionate and poignant. Fantastic Fall 72 version.
All the detail and suspense you'd expect from a Fall '76 Candyman. Nothing wrong with that shiz.
Always a nice treat
Wonderful get the chills from this version, lovely solo from Jerry just fantastic. So sweet and mellow but hair-raising at the same time. Passionate

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: Lots of wah on the guitar for this one the crowd is loving it. Very well done version. Real nice audience puts you there FANTASTIC!

performances.venue: The Palestra, U. of Rochester Rochester, NY
performances.description: Another great 1970 version.
lov the mini acoustic jam in this version.
Not a very good recording, but it gets better towards the end.
It won't make you a Candyman fan, but if you dig that already, you will like this.
As this show's biggest fan, I'm aghast I didn't post this lovely version. Jerry at his most charming. Bruce is in damn good form as well.
This really nice early Candy Man. This one is after Truckin. The first two are sound checks, I think.
Not much of a Candyman guy, but this version is great
Fantastic acoustic rendition of the tune

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Far from the best version, but decent

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Every word is sung perfectly, every note is played perfectly. Great version from an overlooked show
Strong acoustic version
First set is great and this is a prime reason why

performances.venue: Rochester Community War Memorial Rochester, NY
performances.description: One of the few times they played it in 73. Hauntingly beautiful solo as always.
touching
Solid solo & performance, but such great vocals from Garcia.
Solid. Good rainy show at Red Rocks
Good version with a great solo from Jerry. I like this show more and more each time I listen to it!
Might be the fastest version I've heard. Sounds really good, a new matrix just dropped on the Archive. The whole show has an anxious energy to it.

performances.venue: Cole Field House College Park, MD
performances.description: Jerry’s tone is just impeccable here! Moreover, Jerry adds a tad more umph to the soulful vocals. A standout of the era!

performances.venue: Assembly Hall - Indiana University Bloomington, IN
performances.description: Keith stands out on this crystalline version. A stunning performance as the band is completely in synch with each other. Watch out for that solo too.
